message:
If you use a separate process, you can be treat it asynchronously (so no async-over-sync wrappers are necessary). If something goes wrong, terminate the process and you'll get guaranteed cleanup.

QUWI is very low-level; I wouldn't recommend it at all in this case. Task.Run is a modern QUWI. ActionBlock is a higher-level abstraction; as you noted, you can limit the threads with it. But if you encapsulate the call in a separate process, that's what I would recommend.
